text: I wish I could get the bonus disc so I could try Xenogears out. I hear Xenogears was a great game and controlling a mecha sounds cool in a RPG. I liked Xenosaga EP 1 and want to play the rest of the series kind of like when I played Chrono Cross and wanted to play Chrono Trigger. I'm so glad that I eventually played CT even though it was on PSX(load times suck)! Square needs to make another one IMO. Heard it was gonna be called Chrono Break or something I'm not entirely sure.
author: dynodope

text: I'll never get rid of this game. I've yet to traverse the skyscraper and see the other ending though. It was sweet how you could upgrade your weapons with fire and such. The story is so intriguing and hearing about Mitochondria and science stuff is cool. The T-Rex coming alive was awesome in the museum and the FMVs were frickin' sweet!
author: dynodope

text: Mitochondria (the power houses of the cell) have their own DNA. In this game they "wake up" and kill people and mutate things. I recommend playing the game. I believe it's on psn and it's really good if you like ps one rpgs. Also check out mitochondrial eve on wikipedia.

author: Siddharth Bhandari

text: @NorseViking84 Actually, I think the US is pretty well past that. Yeah games like Propeller Arena got canned because the twin towers were in it etc. but look at Crysis 2 that just came out. Hell, the Statue of Liberty is pretty much gone in that game, but no complaints. Lots of games have NYC getting blown up and destroyed, it's a popular setting. I think that sort of paranoia is largely in the past, with some exceptions. You won't see planes crashing into skyscrapers anytime soon for instance.
author: dwatts64

text:
@Frieza102 This is just my assumption, but I'm guessing, if approached with the question of re-mastering PE, you would be told "Due to the fact that many of New York's iconic buildings are destroyed or deformed some way in this game we feel it highly insensitive to re-master this game out of respect of the victims of 9/11."
Unfortunately, I don't think my assuption is too far off either.  Shame...it's a wonderful game.

text:
What the hell is it with Japan and creating awesome biological-horror games? Seriously, between this, and Resident Evil, and Silent Hill, you'd think they were all attending "how to suck audiences in and freak them the FUCK out" courses in college.

And can we hurry up and get Parasite Eve remastered for either PS3 or a portable system? I mean c'mon, you can remaster ninety-eleven final fantasies, but not this fucking DIAMOND? What the hell, Squaresoft?
